Name: Wild Heart's Return
QuestDesc: In Jinzhou, you meet an unusual... human?

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They... They say you have claws...

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We heard you can tear those monsters into shreds...
Wanna take a look?

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes! Please!
Okay, then! Here you go...

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eek...

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: C-Candies!
Try some! I hope these candies can make up for not showing you my impressive claws.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See? He's not scary at all!

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, L-Lingyang!
You're welcome! Do come by to see our liondance show tomorrow!

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will!

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See you soon!
Hmm... you smell unfamiliar, yet so powerful, and so pure...
You must be that famous Rover.
Hiya! I've heard a lot about you, and now I finally get to meet you in person.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can call me Lingyang, glad to make your acquaintance! Fare thee well, blessings swell!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You really are different from everyone else...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So we've shaken hands. Now we're good friends!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... So even you are scared of me, too...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Anyway! Welcome to the city of Jinzhou!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our troupe is doing a big liondancing show tomorrow evening, and I'm now doing some advertising!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, the Liondance Troupe. We do cool liondancing shows for parades.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, and <ano=Taiping Musical>liondancing</ano> is a traditional thing in Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, <ano=Taiping Musical>liondancing</ano> is a traditional thing in Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've got whole groups dedicated to liondancing, our troupe for example.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've got lots of activites in Jinzhou. I can't wait to show you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (his stomach growled...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh! Oops, uh.. Sorry, I guess I'm a bit hungry after rehearsing for a whole day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of that, I should treat you to dinner! Let's talk over food. That'll be fun!

Options.PlotLineKey: That's a thing in Jinzhou too?
You seem a bit too kind...
What do you want from me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well actually... Yes it is! Jinzhou people love feeding our guests! It's our way of showing hospitality.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Get ready to be blown away by the amazing flavors here!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't get me wrong, but this is just how we treat our guests here in Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You'll love the hospitality here, I promise!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: N-Nothing! Please believe me. I'm just trying to treat you to a meal, since you're our super important guest and all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You'll see how we roll with our guests soon enough!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But right now, I still have some other things to finish...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've been getting a ton of requests for private liondances lately, and some happen to overlap with our big show tomorrow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And you know how important liondancing is to the folks here in Jinzhou! Can't just turn 'em down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I had an idea: why not combine all these personal requests into the grand performance? That way, everyone's happy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can even customize the performances to cater to each client's needs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But first, gotta figure out exactly what our clients want!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, wanna come with me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can go visit my clients on our way to grab food. I'll show you around and introduce you to our local customs firsthand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It'll be way cooler than just hearing about it from others. What do you say?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great! Let's goooo!!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You run into Lingyang chatting with some children. He introduces you to the Liondance Troupe and tells you about some of Jinzhou's traditions. He asks you to accompany him in preparing for the upcoming Liondance—and also offers to grab a bite en route.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, let me think.. My first client's nearby. You might've seen them before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just cross the bridge, keep going, and we're there!

Chapters.Title: Visit the first client with Lingyang

Dialogues.Speaker: Ganxue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, you are...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fivefold blessings grace your door, good luck and fortune evermore!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ganxue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aww, the Lucky Greetings... You're from the Liondance Troupe, I bet. Nice to meet you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ganxue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you here for my grandpa's birthday party?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ganxue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought our reservation was tomorrow. Did you maybe mix up the time?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, here's the thing. People from City Hall already booked a liondance show on the same day for soldiers leaving on an expedition.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ganxue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But maybe we can combine your celebrations with this existing show...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ganxue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My grandpa loves hanging out with people. He'd be so happy if you could do that for him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nice! Just double-checking again: It will be your grandfather's 60th birthday, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ganxue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Correct.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, I'll keep that in mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then, I'll do six spins in a row as part of the celebration, which symbolize the six decades your grandpa has lived through!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Means I'll dance around our birthday star on the poles! It's a special birthday celebration dance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One spin for a decade past, health and vigor forever last!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ganxue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you so much. I'm sure grandpa will be happy to hear that!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After talking with the client, Lingyang agrees to celebrate an elderly person's birthday during tomorrow's performance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ganxue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, so you want to learn more about liondancing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ganxue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, I don't know much about it, but my grandpa has always been an invested fan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ganxue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's even friends with Mr. Wufang and Mr. Qixing, who are sorta like advisors to the troupe. They often hang out at Liuxian Teahouse and chat over tea.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ganxue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fun fact: those aren't their real names, just special titles that have been passed down over the generations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ganxue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But everyone knows them by these names now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ganxue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nowadays, they prefer to stay behind the scenes and provide instructions, rather than be in the spotlight themselves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ganxue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you wanna get to know them better, you might just need some good luck.

Chapters.Title: Visit the second client with Lingyang

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Blissful union, endless delight, love eternal in thee alight!

Dialogues.Speaker: Linling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh my, look who's here! Come here, Lingyang!

Dialogues.Speaker: Linling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're getting the wedding candies ready. Here's one for you, and this one here...

Options.PlotLineKey: Blissful union, endless delight, love eternal in thee alight!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for the candies! Actually, I'm here for that liondance request you made...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: City Hall already booked a show for soldiers on the same day, so...

Dialogues.Speaker: Linling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? So you won't be able to perform for us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Linling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We are both born and raised in Huanglong, so we've been super looking forward to the "Liondance Officiant" ceremony during our wedding...

Options.PlotLineKey: Is there anything special about this ceremony?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's an interactive wedding ceremony.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The bride and groom stand on either side of the liondance performer. When the lion head opens its mouth, they put their hands inside and it bites down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's called "Settlement". It symbolizes an unbreakable bond!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know this wedding means everything to you, and I don't want you to have any regrets.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your love is rock solid, and I can see that. The "Liondance Officiant" ceremony would just be the cherry on top of your unbreakable bond.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How about you two exchanging tokens when the lion head reaches the top during tomorrow's performance? It'll be a lively atmosphere with drums, gongs, and firecrackers bursting in celebration...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even though it's not exactly the thing you wanted, isn't it still a unique way to exchange vows in front of your loved ones?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And it symbolizes... "To the world's end your hearts aligned, to the sky's edge your fates entwined!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Linling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aw, that's so sweet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My partner's a soldier in training, headed to defend our borders soon. The liondance show for departing soldiers must mean a lot to him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sheng, what do you say?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shengmao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure, I'm happy to go along with whatever you want.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay. Hmm, we'll need some more time to think it through.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No problem, I'll be waiting to hear from you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After talking with the clients, Lingyang agrees to include the "Liondance Officiant" ceremony in tomorrow's performance to celebrate their wedding.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello, {PlayerName}, what can I do for you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shengmao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh! I know!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shengmao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The soldiers of Jinzhou have a special affection for liondance. It originated from the ancient celebration of Taiping Musical, symbolizing success and a positive beginning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shengmao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Liondance Troupe often travels to boost soldier morale, performing at frontlines and military camps.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shengmao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Liondance mixes boxing with dance, drawing from Huanglong's traditional martial arts for its moves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shengmao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's a folk belief that the liondance's footwork, known as the "Bugang Steps," originated from an ancient ritual that could exorcise evil spirits...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shengmao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Tread on the Dipper's stars, and no evil shall escape"... This is one of the reasons why people believe liondance can ward off evil and bring good luck.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shengmao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When we see the Liondance Troupe, we all hurry to watch. Not just for good luck, but to pick up some combat moves too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Done! Now, onto the next client... Hmm, I remember it's a young couple.

Chapters.Title: Visit the third client with Lingyang

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright! Just one more client to go! He's at the place where we'll be eating our dinner!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uhh... My stomach's rumbling again. Can't wait for a big feast!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here we are. This is the place!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heya, mister! Lionpeppers on the beam, may your profits always stream!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh hi! Isn't that the Lingyang boy?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What brought you here? My liondance request? I heard you're getting a ton of requests. I hope you can still fit mine in.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look, I got the Lionpepper and everything. Just waiting for you to put on the lion head and chow down at my store opening!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sir, there's something I need to tell you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, I heard. My thing conflicts with the performance you're doing for the soldiers, right? Will you have to cancel?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly. So I was thinking we could incorporate some "Lionpepper" elements into the show to make up for it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nah, no need to worry about my little shop, boyo. Just focus on your big performance!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, and you must be...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, looks like Lingyang has made a new friend.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here, try this while you're here! A new snack I just came up with!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go on, {PlayerName}. Dinner's on me. Mr. Shuncai is a great chef!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To really get to know a city, start with the food!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yum-yum! Hey sir, can we share this snack with the audience during our evening show? No snacks, no show!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me do something for you. Anything! To help you attract more customers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh my, that'll be my great honor!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's the matter?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you heard? There's a monster in the wild recently, one they call the Jingle Beast...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Jingle Beast...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah. Somehow the nickname sounds cute even!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you know what? It does all the terrible stuff you can think of!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When hunting, it makes these jingling sounds... They say its tusks are over half a meter long and its claws shred prey with ease.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, that's not true. The "Jingle Beast" doesn't look like that...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It... It's a... A friend of mine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, actually... I need this one ingredient for my new snack, but the Jingle Beast has been messing things up. Can't find good meat anywhere right now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you have other ways to replenish your stock?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's only one place left to get it, and it's run by this Exile group called "The Savages."

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Apparently, they're in cahoots with the Jingle Beast, and that's how they still have meat for sale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But it's crazy expensive—five times the usual price! It's insane!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm just a small shop, how am I supposed to afford that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... I can't make a lot of these snacks for you to hand out yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Me? Oh... I'm fine...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It suddenly struck me that there was another request to deal with... It should be right next to the tea house not far away. Now, if you'll excuse me, I must go!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, {PlayerName}. I'll be back soon!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lingyang treats you to some local Jinzhou specialties at a food stall, suggesting the stall owner—one of his clients—offer snacks during the performance as a way to advertise. However, the owner explains they are short on ingredients due to the disruption caused by a creature known as the "Jingle Beast" and a gang called "The Savages." Hearing this, Lingyang appears deep in thought.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, that's typical Lingyang.

Options.PlotLineKey: Before I could say anything, he's gone...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You'll get used to him soon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's spontaneous, always doing whatever pops into his head at the moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He just loves helping people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You'll often see him sprinting around the alleys, lending a hand wherever needed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's quick and strong, nothing seems to faze him. He's been such a blessing to us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We do feel bad when he injures himself accidentally, though... He brushes it off and tells us not to fret, but even though he says not to worry, we still do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, can you go check on him? Whatever you order at my place will be on the house!

Options.PlotLineKey: Let me finish my food first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course, take your time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The teahouse Lingyang mentioned is in the residential area, just past the square. Keep walking and you'll find it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lingyang heads to a teahouse to take care of an unresolved request. The stall owner expresses concern about Lingyang's tendency to prioritize others over himself and asks if you can check on him. You agree to help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The teahouse? It's in the residential area. Just keep going straight and you'll see it on your left once you're in the neighborhood.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, you must be curious about the opening ceremony with Lionpeppers, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At the ceremony, the Usher playfully throws the Lionpepper on the shop's beam, and then the Liondancer jumps up to bite it off.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a traditional ceremony in Jinzhou, but to be honest, I'm not entirely sure how it started...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But who cares? As long as we get the Liondance Troupe, people will flock to our shop!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's how the "Lionpepper" works its magic on business, I guess.

Chapters.Title: Look for Lingyang around the teahouse

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, but I'm not the one you're looking for. I never made any liondancing requests...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, what brought you here?

Options.PlotLineKey: You didn't pay enough for the meal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not a big deal, really! Thanks for coming to check on me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? Oh no! How much money did it cost you? I'll pay you back!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was really freaked out for a moment. If anyone finds out I let the guest pay, I'll be shamed in Jinzhou!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I received a strange request from the Bei Family. It didn't mention any specific requirements.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could it be your parents?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...No, it can't be. Now, if there's nothing else, please excuse me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please, one moment! Bei Shi... do you have an older brother?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How did you know...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The client who called me had a mature male voice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And since he said he's from the Bei Family, there is only one other possibility...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bei Shi, has something happened to you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm Lingyang from the Liondance Troupe. This is {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can trust us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...It's about my brother, Bei Ji. It's been a week now, and he still hasn't come back home.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A week ago... That's when I received this request.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Was he acting strange the last time you saw him?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My brother and I stopped talking to each other a while back, after a big fight. I don't even know when he last left our house...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... he still sends me packages from time to time. It's been a bunch of strange stuff...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This package has old Angelica flowers, they don't smell good anymore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And these meats... They are almost bad, even though they're refrigerated... Anything else he told you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He mentioned hanging out with people from The Savages in one of his letters...

Options.PlotLineKey: Why didn't you inform the Patrollers?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't tell anyone, because I was worried my brother would get in trouble if I reported it to the police.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, The Savages seem shady. And there's talk of the Jingle Beast being connected to them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the return addresses on these packages are all different. How are we supposed to find him?

Options.PlotLineKey: We can go ask the package delivery people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see... {PlayerName}, you're so clever!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bei Shi, leave it to me! I'll help you find your brother.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can I go with you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I get it, Bei Shi. You really want to find your brother.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But it's dangerous out there with the TD Outbreaks happening more frequently. I can't guarantee your safety if we run into a spreading Tacet Field.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I can handle it. I used to be a member of the Pioneer Association, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Us Pioneers never... never back down from a challenge...

Options.PlotLineKey: Don't bite off more than you can chew.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... I...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you insist... Okay, but we'll need to ask {PlayerName} about it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {Male=He;Female=She} is a strong Resonator. With {Male=him;Female=her}, we'll be safer on our journey.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To be honest, I don't want to drag my friend into this... But this is an emergency, and Bei Shi want to tag along, so I'm asking a favor of you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, I know it's a big ask...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But please... Please help me!

Options.PlotLineKey: Okay, then, since you're asking for my help...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Amazing! Thank you, {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The guy who brings my packages is always the same dude, and I know where he works.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, let's get this dealt with. {PlayerName}, are you ready?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At the teahouse, you find Lingyang discussing a mysterious request with Bei Shi. They suspect the request came from Bei Shi's brother, Bei Ji, who has been missing for a week and may be involved with "The Savages." To find out more, you and Bei Shi start investigating Bei Ji's packages.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, you ready?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great, let's go!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll wait for you here.

Chapters.Title: Talk with Lingyang and get ready to leave
Talk with Lingyang and get ready to leave

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, you ready?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great, let's go!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll wait for you here.

Chapters.Title: Go to the logistics station ahead

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It should be around here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait... There's someone calling for help...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over there! The Hoochiefs are attacking someone!

Dialogues.Speaker: Courier's Diary
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Day 1: I had one lazy day and now there's a whole convoy of missing packages! They shipped me off to a remote station for punishment. Time to redeem myself as the ultimate delivery hero!

Dialogues.Speaker: Courier's Diary
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Day 2: Played Echo Simulation all day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Courier's Diary
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Day 3: Played Echo Simulation all day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Courier's Diary
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Day 4: Come on! I can't keep playin games!

Dialogues.Speaker: Courier's Diary
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Day 5: Played Echo Simulation all day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Courier's Diary
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Day 6: They're freaking out about a "Tingle Beast" out there in the wild... Scared, wanna bail...

Dialogues.Speaker: Courier's Diary
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Day 7: It IS called the "Tingle Beast" right... Right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Courier's Diary
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No beasts, just Exiles ruining my day. Even more packages gone. Broke my terminal. No Echo Simulation now :( UGH!!

Dialogues.Speaker: Courier's Diary
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Day 8: They tried to force me into delivering stuff for them... Over my dead body! They can feed me to the Tingle Beast for all I care!!

Dialogues.Speaker: Courier's Diary
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Day 9: We Promise, We Deliver!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, h-hello! Anything else I can do for you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I've already told you everything I know...

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is a small logistics station we set up. Humble but well-equipped, so we can provide basic logistics services to our clients.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please help yourself if you need to check anything here... Oh, maybe I should tidy up a bit first...

Options.PlotLineKey: You seem to be hiding something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've got nothing to hide, really. Please feel free to look around.

Chapters.Title: Go in the direction of the cry for help

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew... Thank you! You saved my life!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you alright?

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks for asking. I'm fine. I could have run away, but then the packages wouldn't reach their recipients...

Options.PlotLineKey: Do people often drop off their packages here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course! "We Promise, We Deliver"! That's our slogan at the Lollo Logistics!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All packages must be transferred at this station, but we rarely see anyone dropping off their packages here. If someone did, I will surely remember them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're searching for a missing person who used your service. Can you help us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure! You just saved my life. I'll tell you everything I can remember!

Options.PlotLineKey: Does this look familiar to you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, I'm sorry, but this doesn't ring any bell...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But we just checked the package tracker, and it said you were the deliveryman...

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...M-Maybe it was a mistake?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see... Well, we still have another question.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The "Twinkle Beast"? You mean that monster everyone's been talking about recently?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean the "Jingle Beast", right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, whatever. That dangerous, man-eating thing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's said to have long tusks and sharp claws that can tear anything to shreds...

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And there's this Exile group, called "The Savages," and they claim to be able to talk to that beast.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So people have been paying them to talk the "Jingle Beast" out of attacking humans...

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "The Savages"... Yeah, sounds familiar...

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you know the "Tingle Beast"? That monster everyone's been talking about recently.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean the "Jingle Beast", right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, whatever. That dangerous, man-eating thing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's said that they know how to communicate with that ferocious beast.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So people have been paying them to talk the "Jingle Beast" out of attacking humans...

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's all I know, sir.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, but I've got one last question.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you know where we can find The Savages, or the Jingle Beast?

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Sorry, but we have our rules to f-follow... I cannot divulge details of our clients.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I heard the Jingle Beast is often found roaming in a campsite. It's somewhere near a broken tree, on that mountainside...

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those working on the guard tower can often spot it, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. Thank you for answering my questions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sir, may I remind you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That thing is very dangerous... It's ferocious beyond your wildest imagination. Please be careful...

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And there may be more than one of them...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry! If there really was a second Jingle Beast... Well, I'll have to see it for myself!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The deliveryman thanks you and leaves...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh well... We didn't get anything useful from him...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah. At least now we know The Savages and the Jingle Beast are definitely connected.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, did you see his expression?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He seemed frightened. I bet he was hiding something from us out of fear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, but at least we still got some clues from him. Like where we can find the Jingle Beast.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: B-but there are so many campsites in the wild, how can we pinpoint its exact location with a couple words from him?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Follow me. Let's keep our eyes open for anything unusual.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A courier tells you that locals have been paying "The Savages" to fend off the "Jingle Beast." With this clue, you head to the area where the beast is often spotted.

Chapters.Title: Follow Lingyang's tips to find suspicious camps

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Campsite near a broken tree, and visible from the guard tower... I think I know where it is.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's the place. Let's look around and stay alert.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From the size of this campsite, it doesn't look like they can hold a big gathering here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The broken tree... It should be somewhere up ahead. Let's keep walking!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm? I just heard people talking. It's coming from above that slope...

Chapters.Title: Follow Lingyang's tips to find suspicious camps

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shh... Let's stay low...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's not step on those bushes. Try not to make any noise!

Chapters.Title: Follow Lingyang's tips to find suspicious camps
Find a suitable location and eavesdrop on The Savages' conversations

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How did it go?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, you're so smart, boss! That "Jingle Beast" rumor really did the trick!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So they're really here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shh... Keep quiet. Do you see these bushes?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These bushes are not supposed to grow so well on exposed ground.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Must be planted on purpose. There might be traps hiding underneath.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's stay put and listen to what they're saying.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, about that new guy. He's been getting things down quickly, I'll give him that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's too nosy. Can't shut up about the "Jingle Beast."

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let him go find the beast if he's so eager.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And then we'll handle him ourselves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Boss, I heard this guy we're dealing with is tough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He probably won't believe in the "Jingle Beast" rumor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's see how he feels after we rough him up in the dark.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You get it now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Brilliant plan, boss. You're relentless.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, watch and learn, kid.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're just a pup. You don't know what really scares people...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I'll come with you this time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright everyone, let's go! Grab your stuff!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew... Are they gone?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... Wait, they're still nearby.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can still hear them breathing. They're on high alert.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But they're still inexperienced by beast standards.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, now they've gone farther away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go check it out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Near an Exile's camp, you overhear that "The Savages" are exploiting the "Jingle Beast" legend. You also learn that a new member has joined their ranks hoping to find the Beast.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They don't seem to have a solid plan or established routes yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They seem disorganized, probably a new gang.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, you found anything over there?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yep, don't worry. I'm keeping watch.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If something happens, you'll know first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can focus on finding clues. Let us know if you find anything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What on earth are they doing...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My brother... Is he really working for these people?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is... This is my brother's device.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How could this be... Is my brother really working for those bad guys?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bei Shi, what kind of person is he?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's shy and careful, but not sneaky. He may be timid, but he really loves me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bei Shi... Sometimes, we can't trust what we hear or see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have to use our hearts and logic to uncover the real truth, it's not always obvious.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Thank you. I see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, you found anything else?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's just the tusk of an adult Sabyr Boar. It's indeed larger than usual, but...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They must be using this to make people believe the "Jingle Beast" is real.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's been refrigerated for a while, but the inside has spoiled... Exactly like the thing we found in one of those packages...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can even smell the chemical preservatives in there...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're not just spreading rumors, they are also selling spoiled meat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh... It pisses me off, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The top priority now is to find clues about Bei Ji's whereabouts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now we have another problem. We have to keep tabs on "The Savages" to see what they're planning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to what we just heard, their next victim is about to show up.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll go look for Bei Ji.
I'll go look for The Savages.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sounds good. The Savages are super alert, but I know the wilderness better than them. I can track them down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, I understand your anger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But they are super alert. It'll be too risky for you to go alone. Besides, I know the wilderness better than them. Maybe I should go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want to ask you to take Bei Shi and go look for her brother.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She'll be safer with you by her side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If anything happens, I'll "call" you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, {PlayerName}. You take care of yourself too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everything points to "The Savages" spreading rumors about the "Jingle Beast" and selling spoiled ingredients. You discover the new recruit is Bei Ji. To keep you safe, Lingyang volunteers to investigate "the Savages" himself while you and Bei Shi focus on finding Bei Ji.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This thing may still be working.  My brother could have left me a message...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... Ah! There is a message!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji (Hologram)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry Bei Shi... I stood between you and your dreams.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji (Hologram)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps you were right... Your brother is just a selfish coward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji (Hologram)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't dream of your forgiveness... But still...  I want to do something for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji (Hologram)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Farewell, Bei Shi. I'll kill the Jingle Beast... for you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji (Hologram)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The video ends here...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-It's my brother...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's probably because I joined the Pioneer Association.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My brother was really against my decision...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But that was my childhood dream, so we had a big fight...

Options.PlotLineKey: Why is he trying to kill the "Jingle Beast"?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I don't know. He never told me anything about it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Ring... Ring...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eek!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... It must be the Jingle Beast!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know... I know that sound too well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A while ago, when I was on a mission in the wilderness, I got ambushed by Tacet Discords...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As I struggled to escape, I heard the sound of a bell ringing in the distance...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I can't remember... I was so scared, my mind went completely blank.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After hearing the bell, I...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I just kept running without looking back. That bell kept chasing me and only disappeared when I reached a safer place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I hadn't made it, perhaps I would have been eaten by the Jingle Beast...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... Yes, this must be the Jingle Beast again!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright... L-Let's go...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bei Shi shares that Bei Ji has been feeling guilty about her. She also opens up about her fear of the "Jingle Beast," which stems from a past encounter out in the wild.

Chapters.Title: Go in the direction of the bell

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}! Wow, it's only been minutes since I sent you the signal. Didn't expect you to arrive so soon!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: While I was tailing The Savages, I overheard them talking about where Bei Ji went.

Options.PlotLineKey: Did you hear the bell ringing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A loud bell ringing? I think I heard something like that, but...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I didn't... I didn't see anything like the Jingle Beast.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's stick with the Bei Ji thing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you remember what we overheard at the campsite? They mentioned a newbie who was obsessed with the Jingle Beast.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And just now, they sent him to some deep cave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sure I did hear the bell ringing... So the Jingle Beast is probably hiding in here, too!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well... Given how big it is, I don't think it could fit inside a cave like this. What do you say?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I do smell danger from this cave though...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Based on what we've gathered so far, the newbie, probably Bei Ji, is in danger. We need to act fast.

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's go. Time is ticking down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...{PlayerName}, I've always known how strong you are.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I probably shouldn't be asking you for more help, but Bei Ji is in danger, the situation's looking dire, and we need your aid.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could you please help us rescue him? Your help would mean everything to me!

Options.PlotLineKey: Sure, I'm curious what really happened.
Let's help him reunite with his family.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once we find him, we must make him explain. Everything!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah. His sister is super worried too!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course! You have my word!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I'm going with you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My brother's in there. I want to find him as soon as possible...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bei Shi, I understand how much you want to find your brother.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But it's really dark inside, and we've got no idea what could be hiding in there. We'll be stretched thin just watching each other's backs...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, I have a more important thing for you to do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need you to go back to the city as fast as you can, let Patrollers know what happened today, and request their help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... I don't want to run away from danger anymore...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bei Shi... As an explorer of the Pioneer Association, I trust you understand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A seasoned explorer knows how to make sound decisions in the moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And sometimes, choosing to retreat doesn't mean we are weak.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please trust {PlayerName} and me. We promise to bring your brother back safely.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Yes, I will. Please help him!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And please stay safe, you two!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No worries. We'll bring him back!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lingyang tells you that "The Savages" have taken Bei Ji to a cave. Sensing danger, he suggests you join him in the rescue while Bei Shi alerts the Patrollers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This place... It's full of different smells. Plants, beasts, Tacet Discords, and... humans.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm pretty good at pathfinding. Leave it to me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look. I bet Bei Ji dropped this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From what Bei Shi described, Bei Ji doesn't sound like someone brave enough to come here alone...

Options.PlotLineKey: He came here for the Jingle Beast.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But why does he have this bizarre obsession with the Jingle Beast?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I guess this is the only way ahead. Let's keep going.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like one just appeared—I'll handle it, stay back!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The rocks just fell and blocked our way. Ugh, Bei Ji must have passed through here already.

Options.PlotLineKey: We'll have to find another route around.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here! I'll break this rock!

Chapters.Title: Switch to Lingyang to break the rocks
Use Plunging Attack to break the rocks

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoops, this guy is completely blocking our way!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not too difficult to fight against, but it's a total wrecking ball. If we fight it here, it could bring down the entire cave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, and it keeps one nostril open for food scents even when it's asleep. We can turn that against it and use a scent it hates to repel it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sniff sniff... Yup, that's the Noctemint! Let's put it by the Spearback and see what happens.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The scent is coming from below.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The rocks here look so funny. They kinda resemble the Plum Blossom Poles we use in liondancing... How about this!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Kick kick slide, twirl and glide...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oops! Sorry, I always recite this as I hop on the poles.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I got carried away and said it out loud...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, so many thorns here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One prick from these thorns hurts more than a fall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's glide over them!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Grrr... More thorns? No way!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, I'm here with you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Noctemint smells near. Let's go and have a look!

Chapters.Title: Use Plunging Attack to break the rocks

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watch out! More Tacet Discords!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, let's get out of here!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Feels like an earthquake when it moves...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wow... I didn't expect the insides of this cave to look like this. This is so beautiful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This plant only grows in dark places, and I haven't seen it in a long time... I miss it a little.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's keep moving.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where do you think you are runnin' to, brat?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Didn't expect you to make it this far. Shame these monsters didn't get you yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh well, at least we'll get to claim your sorry corpse later...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I'm not afraid of you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know all the dirty things you've done!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I've already sent out proof against you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even if you kill me... It won't change the truth!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are still brave people out there... They will stand up to you... I know they will...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I knew it! Bei Ji wasn't working with them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? Our prey is finally here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who are you? Run! Run while you can! They're targeting me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Run? Don't even even think about it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You think you were smooth?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We saw you spying and creeping up on us. We just played dumb to lure you in...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...and now we gotcha. Time to pay for your sneaky ways!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Boss, you're the best!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Surrender now and you may die in one piece!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why would you choose to live like a beast when you could be a human?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you call yourself beasts, then you should know... every beast has its own hunting game.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sometimes, a beast pretends to be weak... to give their prey a false sense of security. Make them assume they're the hunters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I haven't been this angry in a while.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, we'll show them no mercy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When you reach the cave, Bei Ji faces "The Savages" with resolve, determined to bring them to justice before you and Lingyang arrive to help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since you've chosen to act like beasts... I'll handle you the way beasts do!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Crap...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh no, Boss... I heard once his tail starts wagging real fast, he's unstoppable in battle...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So what?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: B-but his tail's wagging like crazy now!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Humph, I haven't revealed my true strength yet...

Options.PlotLineKey: Guess we went too easy on them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wow... you're so strong!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hah...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't stand a chance against me in the wilderness. Submit while you can.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Or would you prefer getting torn into shreds?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha... You've startled "those things" awake...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Boss... What do we do now?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're fighting them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're running, of course!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? Wait, wait! Boss!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, watch out!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't you dare lay a claw on {Male=him;Female=her}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Defeating "The Savages" causes a commotion that awakens three Spearbacks in the cave. To protect you, Lingyang steps in to take on them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hiss... Grrr... You hurt my friend... You die!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, sorry I let you see this side of me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please keep it a secret between the two of us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. That would be great.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm alive! Thank you for saving me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh and sorry but, who are you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My sister... Bei Shi? She's been worried about me? Is she doing okay?

Options.PlotLineKey: She's worried sick. Hasn't slept in seven days.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's good to hear... Thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What?! Oh, Bei Shi... I'm so sorry... I'm such an awful brother.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lingyang recounts every detail of the events to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't expect she would... I'm sorry.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry I made you worry too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, I guess you've already heard some of it from her...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our parents were both members of the Pioneer Association. They were famous explorers, until we lost them to an accident.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've been struggling to survive since then. I did many part-time jobs to make ends meet, trying to take care of my sister.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But Bei Shi... She said she wanted to join the Pioneer Association, and fulfill our parents' unfinished ambitions...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's the last family I have. I was really scared I'd lose her, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I tried to ban her from joining the Pioneer Association, and we got into a huge fight. We haven't really talked to each other ever since...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But, to be honest... When she was accepted to join the Association, I was really happy for her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unlike me, she is brave, positive, and always willing to try new things. As her brother, I'm happy she'll get to see a bigger world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looking back on it, I was holding her back from pursuing her dreams.

Options.PlotLineKey: You should have respected her decision.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Yes. I shouldn't have tried to make the decision for her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's too dangerous here. Let's get out first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your sister's been worried about you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lingyang asks you to keep his beastly side a secret. After hearing about your efforts, Bei Ji opens up about his conflict with Bei Shi, sharing his true feelings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why... Why did this happen?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When it rains, it pours...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fierce Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is not what I had planned!

Options.PlotLineKey: You can't always get what you want.

Dialogues.Speaker: Serious Patroller
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Behave!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lingyang! Rover!

Dialogues.Speaker: Upright Patroller
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks for the tip, young lady. We made it in time to catch them because of you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lingyang! {PlayerName}! Are you alright?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bei Shi...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bei Ji!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bei Shi, I'm so sorry I made you worry...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though seeing your reunion is truly touching...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I still gotta say, this isn't the right place for conversation. Let's head back to the city first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the Patrollers' help, you catch "The Savages" and the Bei siblings are finally reunited.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, when you found out that Bei Shi lost her courage because of the Jingle Beast, you came up with a plan to get rid of it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah... I thought I could kill the Jingle Beast, and make my sister happy again...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And I heard rumors about an Exile group called "The Savages." Said they knew how to talk to that beast...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I thought...

Options.PlotLineKey: You wanted to find the Jingle Beast through them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes... I wanted to prove my courage. Wanted to make her proud of me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I just wanted to show her... If her timid brother could do it, so can she!

Options.PlotLineKey: Being brave is not the same as being reckless.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But in the end, I couldn't achieve anything...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, you're right...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I failed. Couldn't find the Jingle Beast, couldn't beat the bad guys. I only knew how to cower in fear... that's all I could do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm just an incompetent coward. I've always been!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... That's not true...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At least, you didn't choose to work with those bad guys.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Succumbing to desire and killing their own kind, these are the deeds of beasts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a uniquely human trait to go against their natural instincts, even sacrificing themselves for someone else, or for a greater cause.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It only takes a moment for a human to descend into beastliness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But holding on to one's humanity requires unwavering commitment and courage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bei Ji, you've already proved your bravery.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sure your sister is proud of you, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: R-really...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes! I love you, brother. But promise me you won't do anything stupid again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, yes, I promise you... But, um, at least I did find something this time!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We now know the so-called Jingle Beast is just a bluff!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, Bei Shi, you don't need to fear it anymore!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I did hear the bell...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps it was just your imagination? Or maybe it was some Tacet Discords?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No way! I heard it loud and clear. I couldn't have mistaken it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... I guess we still need to help Bei Shi get over the Jingle Beast.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why is she still so convinced?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, Lingyang, we'll be going home now. Sorry for the trouble I caused.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure, go get some good rest. Don't forget to come see the liondancing show tomorrow!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eh? Tomorrow?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't tell me you've forgotten your liondance request?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, no, I didn't...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry. Actually, I made that request to further investigate the Jingle Beast...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But now, I guess that's no longer necessary.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know you've still got questions about the Jingle Beast. Who knows? You may find the answers in tomorrow's liondancing show...

Options.PlotLineKey: The liondancing show tomorrow is really important.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. We'll come watch the show!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, please do come, okay?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bei Shi and Bei Ji wave goodbye before taking their leave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, I know you still have a lot of questions to ask...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And there are things I'd like to discuss with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please, follow me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You learn that Bei Ji had originally planned to kill the "Jingle Beast" to prove his courage and earn his sister's respect. Though he feels like he has failed, Lingyang reminds him that true bravery lies in overcoming one's weaknesses for those we care about. Bei Ji gains Bei Shi's understanding, but her fear of the "Jingle Beast" remains. To help her, Lingyang invites the siblings to watch the Liondance, believing it may help dispel Bei Shi's fear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Keep going down this road and we'll reach the theater. But I guess you've been here many times already...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, let's just hang out a bit while we're here!

Chapters.Title: Go to the theater with Lingyang

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sir! May your business boom!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, Lingyang!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After our adventure in the wilderness, the hustle and bustle brings a comforting sense of prosperity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I must... do what I can to keep it thriving.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have a happy wedding, Ms. Linling!

Dialogues.Speaker: Linling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, Lingyang!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, Ms. Ganxue's shop is always so popular. Let's not bother her for now!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her souvenirs are all made with care. I'm sure people will love them!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, you two! Just came back from outside the city? Or are you going somewhere?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember to eat on time no matter how busy you are!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, and when my store opens, you must visit! I'd love to see you there!

Dialogues.Speaker: Linling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lingyang! {PlayerName}! Nice to see you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Linling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And oh, about the wedding suggestion... We may still need some time to think over it. It's our once-in-a-lifetime thing, after all!

Dialogues.Speaker: Linling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But we'll surely go watch your liondancing show! This I am sure of!

Chapters.Title: Go to the theater with Lingyang

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew, and now we're back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lingyang! You're finally here! Master's been looking for you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh no! I completely forgot!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, could you look around backstage for a bit? See if you can find anything that might help Bei Shi overcome her fear...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll be right back!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hurry up! Master's getting angry!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm coming! I'm coming!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lingyang asks you to check backstage for props that might help Bei Shi form a new opinion about the "Jingle Beast."

Chapters.Title: Look for the right props at the theater backstage

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A handwritten pamphlet titled Lucky Greetings Collection. Signs of regular revisions can be noticed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It records in details all the popular Lucky Greetings from Huanglong, including the ones often spoken by Lingyang.

Chapters.Title: Look for the right props at the theater backstage

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, {PlayerName}, I'm back!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My Master is super strict before our performances. He wants us to give our all for the people of Jinzhou. Can't disappoint them!

Options.PlotLineKey: Why are liondance shows such a big deal in Jinzhou?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... Let's begin with the history of this tradition.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Liondance shows started as a way to cheer up returning soldiers and boost their morale before battles.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It evolved over time into a way to boost soldiers' spirits before battle, symbolizing courage and the hope for victory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Later on, it transformed into the festive performance we see today, but it's still about keeping bad luck away, dispelling fear, and passing prosperity and protection to future generations.

Options.PlotLineKey: What does this have to do with Bei Shi?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bei Shi got hit pretty hard during the attack, and she probably blanked out for a bit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then, perhaps her brain made up some fake memories about that creepy Jingle Beast in the rumors to fill in the gaps.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bei Ji wanted to kill the Jingle Beast to help his sister. Indeed, getting rid of the thing she fears could work.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But that won't solve the real issue.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like we heard on our way here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The scary beast comes with many different names. We can defeat the Jingle Beast now, but another Twinkle Beast could appear later.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not enough to just defeat that one Jingle Beast. One must have the courage to take on any beasts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why I want help Bei Shi overcome her fear with our liondance performance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As the liondance evolved, it picked up various new styles and elements, which hold unique significance to each person.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our goal is to create a customized performance that truly benefits Bei Shi.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, gotta go prep now! See you at tomorrow's liondance show!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before the performance, Lingyang shares the origin and meaning of the Liondance, suggesting that it might help Bei Shi overcome her fear of the "Jingle Beast."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Liondance Troupe Staff
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You got all the props ready?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ardent Liondance Troupe Staff
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ardent Liondance Troupe Staff
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Silk balls, drumsticks, gongs... and dried fish!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Liondance Troupe Staff
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What are the dried fish for?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ardent Liondance Troupe Staff
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To treat our Liondancer, of course!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Liondance Troupe Staff
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: C'mon, he's not a cat! You should get him some grilled meat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ardent Liondance Troupe Staff
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? Thought he'd like dried fish...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Liondance Troupe Staff
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, can't say I'm an expert on this...

Dialogues.Speaker: Serious Liondance Troupe Staff
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, but this is a staff only area.

Dialogues.Speaker: Serious Liondance Troupe Staff
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, it's Rover. Hello.

Dialogues.Speaker: Serious Liondance Troupe Staff
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lingyang's busy getting ready for the performance, so he can't meet you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Serious Liondance Troupe Staff
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anything you want to say, I'll pass it along to him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is Mr. Wufang here? If Mr. Qixing is around, that works too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Busy Liondance Troupe Staff
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello sir. Why are you looking for them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've been their fan for ages!

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watched their liondance since I was a kid.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't ask for much. Just one photo with them would make my day!

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Miss, can you please let me in?

Dialogues.Speaker: Busy Liondance Troupe Staff
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're quite busy right now, but I'll let them know. Sir, would you mind coming back after the performance?

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, miss, thank you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Sophisticated Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh my, how did you get here? Come on, we're going home!

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I wanna be a Liondancer when I grow up!

Dialogues.Speaker: Sophisticated Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? Why you want to be a Liondancer? Can you tell mommy?

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because the big lion's so cool! I can scare away bad people and keep mommy safe!

Dialogues.Speaker: Sophisticated Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aww. But it takes a lot to be a Liondancer, you know?

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can do it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Sophisticated Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, then it depends on whether Mr. Wufang and Mr. Qixing are willing to accept you as their student?

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... I have candies! I hope they'll like my candies...

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gosh, I'm so nervous...

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is our first time watching the liondance show together...

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, the show hasn't started yet, but just seeing such a grand stage already makes my heart race!

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Which side do you think the lion's gonna show up from? Left or right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello there, Rover. I think we've met once.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm the "Drummer" of the Liondance Troupe. You can call me Chie.

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you the only Drummer in the Liondance Troupe?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes and no.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just as people say, "Feel the drum and dance along." When it comes to lion dance, there's no set tune. That's why the cooperation between the dancers and drummers is key.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Drummers have to match the Liondancers' moves, while the dancers must follow the drumbeats.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's like a dance between the two, with the drums guiding the lion's movements and the lion depicting it through their posture and expressions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why we all need to study both liondancing and drumming to better understand each other.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In short, every member of the Liondance Troupe can be a "Drummer."

Options.PlotLineKey: That sounds like a lot of work.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, yeah! Every impressive performance requires years of hard work behind the scenes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, the show's starting now. Remember to cheer for us!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Enjoy the show!

Dialogues.Speaker: Granpa Gan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh! You must be that famous Clo... Clover?

Dialogues.Speaker: Granpa Gan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hahahaha... Sorry, my memory's not what it used to be!

Dialogues.Speaker: Granpa Gan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My granddaughter said you and Lingyang did a lot for me. Thank you so much.

Dialogues.Speaker: Granpa Gan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As I get older, my memory's not as sharp...

Dialogues.Speaker: Granpa Gan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I'll never forget that one liondance show I watched when I was in the military.

Dialogues.Speaker: Granpa Gan
