Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The booming Qixing Drum sounded like roars of ferocious lions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Granpa Gan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone in the troop felt unstoppable back then!

Dialogues.Speaker: Granpa Gan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I never thought that I'd have the chance to watch something like that again... It's bringing up a lot of feelings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hi, {PlayerName}, fancy seeing you here!

Dialogues.Speaker: Linling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sheng and I have been discussing our choices, and we still want to give the "Settlement" ceremony a try.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, things were a little rushed this time, and we aren't really ready yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So we've decided to postpone our wedding. We'll choose a good date later!

Options.PlotLineKey: Any day is good when you love each other.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aww, that's so sweet. Did you learn that from Lingyang?

Dialogues.Speaker: Linling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I didn't expect this liondance show to be so big.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is probably the first time I've watched such a big show ever since I met Sheng.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shengmao
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, I can't wait for it to start...

Dialogues.Speaker: Granpa Gan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What a great stomp on the Dipper poles! What an impressive jump! Haha!

Options.PlotLineKey: Nice to see you again, sir.

Dialogues.Speaker: Granpa Gan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, I'm still thinking about the show we just watched!

Dialogues.Speaker: Granpa Gan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What an amazing show. I'd say it rivals the shows in my time!

Dialogues.Speaker: Granpa Gan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The new Liondancer they picked really did a great job!

Dialogues.Speaker: Granpa Gan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our future is in good hands with these youngsters!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}? Weren't you planning to catch the liondance show? It's about to start, no?’

Options.PlotLineKey: I want to get some food.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure, here you go! I just heard the supply issue has been resolved. I should get you some extra for free!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh well. I really wanted to catch the show, but, you see, I've got so many clients here! Can't step away for a moment!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I really wanted to go, but, you see, I've got so many clients here! Can't step away for a moment!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I just heard the supply issue has been resolved! Thank you so much for your help. Help yourself to some food while you're here. It's on the house!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have fun watching the show! Tell Lingyang I said hi!

Chapters.Title: Go to the theater the next afternoon (15:00-17:00)
Look for Bei'ji and Bei'shi in the audience area

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hi, {PlayerName}, there you are!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's been quite a while since I last saw a grand liondance show like this. I'm so excited about it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, do you know what the secret is about the Jingle Beast Lingyang was talking about?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, the show's beginning!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You meet with various clients before the performance. The Bei siblings are curious about the secret of the "Jingle Beast," while Grandpa Gan reminisces about the Liondance performances he enjoyed during his time in the army. Linling and Shengmao decide to give the "Settlement" ceremony another go, and everyone awaits the grand Liondance with excitement.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hi Rover, you're back? How was the show?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, of course! The liondances in Jinzhou are truly spectacular! I'll definitely go watch it myself next time!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shuncai
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, I'll be getting ready to go home. You're welcome to visit my place again anytime, {PlayerName}!

Chapters.Title: Go to the backstage of the theater and look for Lingyang

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was once chased by a big creature in the wilderness. All I could hear was a bell ringing and my only thought was to run away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then I heard about the Jingle Beast, so I figured it must have been what attacked me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But when I saw you perform today, it all came back to me! That's the same bell ringing sound I had heard back then!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... I must have been saved by that bell.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The bell that sounded like it was chasing after me... It was actually guiding me away from danger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The liondance inspires and empowers each person in a unique way. I'm glad my performance could give you courage and inspiration.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah! I loved your performance! I think I can keep working as Explorer for the Pioneer Association now!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bei Shi, that's amazing!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When you joined the Association, I was actually so proud... I'm happy you get to keep chasing your dreams...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And, erm, please forgive me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am upset, because you never told me anything... You always carried the burden alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Shi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Didn't even tell me you were gonna go kill the Jingle Beast... Don't you ever do something like that again!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I promise, I promise. Let me treat you to something as my sincere apology.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know a nice food stall, it's right up ahead in the square. You should check it out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bei Ji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Awesome! Bei Shi, let's go!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, how was my performance? Did you like it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, getting your compliment is all that matters to me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... Guess I still need to hone my skills a bit more...

Options.PlotLineKey: Bravo! Bravo indeed! Such a blessing to witness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're making me blush, {PlayerName}...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, I'm super glad to hear that from you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, thank you so much for your help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I couldn't have accomplished any of this without you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, sure... Let's talk somewhere more private.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks to the Liondance performance, Bei Shi can recall how the sound of a bell saved her during a previous attack in the wild. Her fears begin to shift as her courage is restored.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, let's talk here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where should I begin...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, have you ever thought about this...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since there are humans with Resonance Abilities...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Then, could there ever be beasts with the same kind of power?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uncontrolled emotions in human Resonators lead to <ano=Overclocking>disasters</ano>. It's even more dangerous in beasts, as they follow instincts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over time, most of them died out, driven extinct by their unrestrained desires.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beasts that can bring their power under control are extremely rare, but... they do exist.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the Jingle Beast... It happens to be one of them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A long, long time ago, the Jingle Beast wasn't called the Jingle Beast. It used to have a name—

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was called "Suan'ni."

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back then, the Suan'nis lived a tranquil life in deep forests, far away from humans.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, when the Tacet Fields expanded rapidly, their territories were not spared.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some of them had to encroach upon certain human territories for a chance to survive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Humans suffered greatly against the Suan'nis, with their terrifying appearance, powerful Resonance Abilities, and wild animal instincts...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...And that's why the Suan'nis were deemed evil.

Options.PlotLineKey: How do you know all that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh... I read it in an old book in Huanglong. Said they lived under that giant Violet Banyan tree in the Dim Forest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Suan'nis have nearly gone extinct over the years. And now, there might be only one of them remaining.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And... I've heard of an interesting theory from the archaeologists...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That last Suan'ni might have yearned to become a human.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To make itself more approachable, it first came up with a less intimidating name... Something like, the "Jingle Beast."

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And then, it yanked off all its fur, filed down its claws, twisted its bones, and learned to stand upright...

Options.PlotLineKey: Why did it want to become human so bad?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe... It was drawn by the bustle and merriment of human cities. It must have been lonely as the last of its kind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe it was moved by human bravery against the Lament, and wanted to offer help. Maybe it wanted to fight the catastrophe that ruined its once homeland.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or maybe, it simply couldn't resist human foods?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway... It never really became a human in the end.

Options.PlotLineKey: Is it because of its appearance?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If it truly wanted to become human, it had to first understand the essence of what makes a human.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you ask me, the essence would be the 'heart' of a human.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Therefore, the "Jingle Beast" no longer rejected its appearance and began to, in its animal form, connect with humans, to assist them...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps, in this process, it happened to save a girl in the wilderness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, what do you think the ending for the "Jingle Beast" was? Did it finally become a human?

Options.PlotLineKey: It has a long way to go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well... is that what you think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think the "Jingle Beast" no longer cares whether it's a human or a beast. It lives in its own way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In this world, there are beings with the appearance of a beast and the soul of a human, just as there are beings with the appearance of a human and the soul of a beast. All it needs to do is be true to itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It will remain resolute and convey the beautiful and inspiring qualities it once saw in humans in its own way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oops, I got carried away and almost forgot—here, keep this bell as a memento!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, {PlayerName}!
Lingyang! Come here!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Coming!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, I must go get the props ready for the next show.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come watch my performance again next time! Food's on me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lingyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please keep this bell! It should bring you good luck! Fare thee well, blessings swell!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the end, Lingyang reveals the truth about the "Jingle Beast"—it is the last "Suan'ni." Moved by humanity's bravery against the Lament, this creature longed to become one of them. It had been trying to understand what it means to be human and ultimately discovered that the answer lies in the "heart." Since that day, it has sought to express the beauty it sees in humans in its own unique way.
